description: Average daily mean temperature
Average daily minimum temperature
Average daily maximum temperature
Number of frost days given by TN < 0 °C
Number of summer days given by TX > 25 °C
Number of hot days given by TX > 30 °C
Number of icing days given by TX < 0 °C
Number of tropical nights given by TN > 20 °C
Kysely days are defined as count of days in periods of at least 3 consecutive days with TX ≥ 30 °C on the first day and TX ≥ 25 °C on subsequent days while the average TX during those days is ≥ 30 °C
Growing season length is the number of days between the first 6-day period where TG > 5 °C and the first 6-day period where TG < 5 °C (in the second half of the year)
Growing season start is the day of the year of a 4-day period where TG > 5 °C
Backlash onset/spring frost is the number of days where TN < -2 °C for all days after GSS (growing_season_start) and up to day 180 of the year
Spring backlash index represents GDD5 (growing degree days above 5 °C) for all days after GSS and up to the last spring_backlash event
Maximum value of daily maximum temperature
Maximum value of daily minimum temperature
Minimum value of daily maximum temperature
Minimum value of daily minimum temperature
Percentage of days when TN < 10th percentile (ref_period for threshold is 1991-2020)
Percentage of days when TX < 10th percentile (ref_period for threshold is 1991-2020)
Percentage of days when TN > 90th percentile (ref_period for threshold is 1991-2020)
Percentage of days when TX > 90th percentile (ref_period for threshold is 1991-2020)
Consecutive frost days is the max length of TN < 0 °C
Consecutive summer days is the max length of TX > 25 °
Warm spell duration index is the number of days within warm spells which are defined as 6-day consecutive periods where TX > 90th percentile (ref_period for threshold is 1991-2020)
Cold spell duration index is the number of days within cold spells which are defined as 6-day consecutive periods where TN < 10th percentile (ref_period for threshold is 1991-2020)
Hot spell frequency is the number of spell events as defined in WSDI
Cold spell frequency is the number of cold spell events as defined in CSDI
Cold episodes is the number of cold spells defined as continuous periods of at least 5-days where TX < 0 °C
Extreme ice days is the number of days where TN < -7 °C and TX < 0 °C
Thaw period days is the number of days where TG > 1.5 °C
Freeze-thaw days is the number of days where TN < 0 °C and TX > 0 °C
Freeze-thaw days is the number of days where TN < -2 °C and TX > 2 °C
Continentality is the difference between the maximum monthly and minimum monthly TG
Growing degree days above 0 °C is the sum of daily temperature differences above 0 °C
Growing degree days above 5 °C is the sum of daily temperature differences above 5 °C
Growing degree days above 10 °C is the sum of daily temperature differences above 10 °C
Daily temperature range is the average daily difference of TX - TN
Extreme temperature range is the difference between maximum daily TX and minimum daily TN: TXx - TNn
Total precipitation accumulation
Maximum 1-day precipitation
Maximum consecutive 5-day precipitation
90th percentile of wet days (RR > 1 mm) amounts (mm/day) for the respective period
95th percentile of wet days (RR > 1 mm) amounts (mm/day) for the respective period
Mean precipitation
Simple precipitation intensity index is the average precipitation on wet days (RR > 1 mm)
Count of days when RR ≥ 10mm
Count of days when RR ≥ 20mm
Count of days when RR ≥ 30mm
Count of days when RR ≥ 40mm
Count of days when RR ≥ 50mm
Consecutive dry days is the count of days of the longest period where RR < 1 mm
Consecutive wet days is the count of days of the longest period where RR > 1 mm
Minimum of precipitation sums within a moving 30 day window
Maximum of precipitation sums within a moving 30 day window
Sum of precipitation on moderate wet days which is RR > 75th percentile (ref_period 1991-2020)
Sum of precipitation on wet days which is RR > 90th percentile (ref_period 1991-2020)
Sum of precipitation on very wet days which is RR > 95th percentile (ref_period 1991-2020)
Sum of precipitation on extremely wet days which is RR > 99th percentile (ref_period 1991-2020)
Contribution to total precipitation as % from wet days which is RR > 90th percentile (ref_period 1991-2020)
Contribution to total precipitation as % from very wet days which is RR > 95th percentile (ref_period 1991-2020)
Contribution to total precipitation as % from extremely wet days which is RR > 99th percentile (ref_period 1991-2020)
0.95 quantile of antecedent precipitation index (k=7;p=0.9). API is a sum of daily weighted (exponential decay) RR for a specified window k
0.95 quantile of antecedent precipitation index (k=14;p=0.9). API is a sum of daily weighted (exponential decay) RR for a specified window k
0.95 quantile of antecedent precipitation index (k=28;p=0.9). API is a sum of daily weighted (exponential decay) RR for a specified window k
0.95 quantile of precipitation concentration index. PCI is the sum of squared monthly RR divided by the square of the total sum of RR
Summer heat-moisture index is the ratio of maximum monthly TG to average RR of JJA (June July August)
Mean absolute sunshine duration
Mean relative sunshine duration
Mean reference evapotranspiration
Mean potential evapotranspiration (PET) in coldest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Mean monthly potential evapotranspiration (PET) in driest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Mean monthly potential evapotranspiration (PET) in warmest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Mean monthly potential evapotranspiration (PET) in wettest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Mean monthly standard deviation of potential evapotranspiration (PET)
Mean of Standardized Precipitation Evapotranspiration Index (SPEI 30 days)
Mean of Standardized Precipitation Evapotranspiration Index (SPEI 90 days)
Mean of Standardized Precipitation Evapotranspiration Index (SPEI 365 days)
Days with extreme drought counted where SPEI90 < -2
Days with moderate drought counted where SPEI90 < -1
Days with moderate humid conditions counted where SPEI90 > 1
Days with extreme humid conditions counted where SPEI90 > 2
0.95 quantile of total surface snow thickness
0.95 quantile of fresh surface snow thickness
0.95 quantile of total snow water equivalent
0.95 quantile of fresh snow water equivalent
Maximum 72h fresh snow
Snow cover duration above 1 cm
Snow cover duration above 10 cm
0.95 quantile of total surface runoff from snowmelt and rain
0.95 quantile of daily snowmelt
Annual mean temperature (equivalent to TGmean)
Mean diurnal range is the average daily difference of TX - TN (equivalent to DTR)
Isothermality is the ratio of BIO02 / BIO07
Temperature seasonality is the annual coefficient of variation of TG expressed as %
Max temperature of warmest month (equivalent to TXx)
Min temperature of coldest month (equivalent to TNn)
Temperature annual range is the difference of TXx - TNn (equivalent to ETR)
Mean temperature of wettest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Mean temperature of driest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Mean temperature of warmest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Mean temperature of coldest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Annual precipitation sum (equivalent to PRCPTOT)
Precipitation of wettest month (maximum daily RR)
Precipitation of driest month (minimum daily RR)
Precipitation seasonality is the annual coefficient of variation of RR expressed as %
Precipitation of wettest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Precipitation of driest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Precipitation of warmest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Precipitation of coldest quarter (quarters as meteorological seasons)
Number of days with fresh snow greater than 1 cm as calculated from changes in snow depth
Number of days with fresh snow greater than 5 cm as calculated from changes in snow depth
Number of days with fresh snow greater than 10 cm as calculated from changes in snow depth
Number of days with fresh snow greater than 20 cm as calculated from changes in snow depth
Cooling Degree Days is the sum of daily temperature differences above a threshold of 18.3 °C
Heating Degree Days is the sum of daily temperature differences below a threshold of 20 °C
Accumulated precipitation during the summer halfyear (April to September)
Accumulated precipitation during the winter halfyear (October to March)
